node.title: Trevor Noah: ‘Covid Turned the Planet Into a Frat House’
node.description: The latest Covid variant, Omicron, follows Alpha, Lambda and Delta in the Greek alphabet.

node.title: Woods concedes he won't play fulltime professional golf again
node.description: The former world golf number one Tiger Woods concedes he will not play full-time competitive golf again.

node.title: Reeva Steenkamp's parents to meet Oscar Pistorius
node.description: The ex-Paralympian has been moved to a prison closer to the parents of the woman he killed eight years ago, to enable the meeting to go ahead. Reeva Steenkamp's parents...

node.title: 'Extremely irresponsible': International students lash out after long-awaited travel plans cancelled again
node.description: The snap decision to delay the easing of border restrictions leaves many international students again uncertain and confused, with experts saying it could further damage Australia's reputation as an education destination.

node.title: PM in Hamilton to boost vaccination efforts, meet with business leaders
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern is in Hamilton to support vaccination efforts, take part in a business roundtable and turn the sod for the Waikato Regional Theatre.

node.title: 'It is cynical': Immigration blocks pathway for at-risk Afghans to settle in NZ
node.description: The avenue was opened by a court last week for Afghans trapped there to get a visa.

node.title: Police need new approach to quell rising gang violence - expert
node.description: A gang expert says police may need to monitor gangs extremely heavily - or get them in a room together - in a bid to quash any tit-for-tat violence that may be brewing.

node.title: 1/6 Defendant Charged With Tasing Fanone Allegedly Talked of Assassinating President Biden
node.description: The Jan. 6 defendant repeatedly cried during his FBI interview in which he said he attacked the police officer. His lawyer now wants the interview thrown out.

node.title: Former Theranos CEO Holmes Tearfully Testifies About Ex-Lover's Controlling Tactics
node.description: Elizabeth Holmes said Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani would yell and tell her he was "so disappointed in my mediocrity" if she failed to comply with his demands,

node.title: Defence allowed to vet evidence presented to inquiry into bushfire accidentally sparked by its own helicopter
node.description: An ACT coroner has allowed a suppression order on the brief of evidence presented to a bushfire inquiry, so the Department of Defence can determine if there are any security issues.

node.title: Paraglider in critical condition after crashing down cliff face
node.description: The paraglider is in Dunedin Hospital after the crash this afternoon.

node.title: Lawyers Liken Alleged Philadelphia Train Attack to Sexual Assault on Incapacitated Person
node.description: Police say the woman was seen on surveillance video pushing away Fiston Ngoy, 35, multiple times before allegedly being sexually assaulted.

node.title: Susie lives with an inoperable brain tumour. Small town community support has helped her along the way
node.description: Life in regional Australia can be harsh and demanding for people living with a disability but our regions also offer a sense of community which can give hope in challenging times, writes Susie Alderman.

node.title: NSW records wettest November in 100 years — and it couldn't have come at a worse time for some
node.description: Historic downpours this month caused mayhem in parts of the state, including for farmers who watched with dismay as rain they sorely needed two years ago came right at the wrong time.

node.title: 'I could see he was purple and wasn't breathing'
node.description: Rural women are almost twice as likely to give birth prematurely as women who live in major cities — as one Lightning Ridge mother found during her own "very scary situation".

node.title: Dozens of Former Afghan Security Forces Dead or Missing Under Taliban, Report Says
node.description: More than 100 former members of the military and police have been killed or forcibly disappeared by the Taliban since the group came into power, according to an investigation by Human Rights Watch.

node.title: Jussie Smollett, on Trial for Hate-Crime Hoax, Is the Real Victim, His Lawyer Says
node.description: The lawyer told the jury that the alleged attackers were "going to lie to your face."

node.title: Marine heatwave occurring around New Zealand, NIWA says
node.description: The conditions are comparable to November 2017, which NIWA says was the beginning of an "unprecedented marine heatwave".

node.title: Police criticised over handling of Manawatū arrest
node.description: A Palmerston North man should not have been arrested and police acted unprofessionally, the IPCA says.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 134 new community cases today
node.description: There are 134 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in the community today.

node.title: Spike of Homicides Causes Oakland Mayor to Reverse Course on Diverting Funds From Police
node.description: Diverting funds from the police was a move many cities took after the killing of George Floyd, but some, like Oakland, have to shift due to a crime increase.

node.title: In Latest Assault on Dissent, Egypt Convicts a Human Rights Activist
node.description: Hossam Bahgat avoided a prison term, receiving a relatively modest fine, in a verdict that appeared designed to intimidate dissidents without risking international opprobrium.

node.title: State Distribution of Federal Rental Assistance Funds Zooms Upward, But Hurdles Remain
node.description: Over 100 states and cities have distributed the first portion of funds and are starting to distribute the second portion of the $46.5 billion program.

node.title: What does it take for a COVID-19 strain to become a 'variant of concern'?
node.description: There are actually thousands of coronavirus strains out there, but there are a few boxes that need to be ticked before they're escalated to the level Omicron's at.

node.title: Rules that allowed Christian Porter not to disclose who gave him money should be changed, committee finds
node.description: The rules that govern what gifts and donations politicians must disclose need to be fixed, a highly regarded bipartisan committee finds — though it says former attorney-general Christian Porter is not in breach of them.

node.title: Major overhaul of cosmetic surgery industry announced after Four Corners investigation
node.description: The medical regulator announces a major review of patient safety in the cosmetic surgery sector, after Four Corners revealed details of serious hygiene and safety breaches in clinics operated by Dr Daniel Lanzer.

node.title: Human remains found in search for missing Victorian campers
node.description: Police searching for the remains of missing Victorian campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay find human remains in bushland near Dargo, in the state's remote High Country.

node.title: Twitter boss Jack Dorsey to step down
node.description: Twitter chief executive Jack Dorsey will step down from his role and chief technology officer Parag Agrawal will become his successor, the company announced.

node.title: Convicted murderer Scott Watson denied parole again
node.description: The 50-year-old was sentenced to life in prison for the murder of Ben Smart and Olivia Hope on New Year's Day in 1998.

node.title: 6th Intentional Homicide Charge Added For Driver Who Crashed Into Wisconsin Christmas Parade
node.description: The sixth charge is for victim Jackson Sparks, an 8-year-old boy who was walking in the parade with his 12-year-old brother Tucker, who was also injured.
